Recap: Gregory Evans testifies at Dani's custody hearing that Tea said she wanted Ross to raise Dani. Dani tells Destiny that she wants to stay with Todd. Blair tells Dani and Des that Greg said Dani should go with Todd. Todd and Blair wonder how Ross got Greg to lie for him. Destiny demands to know if Greg was telling the truth. John meets Natalie at Rodi's and tells her about Greg's unusual testimony.

Clint tells Natalie that John should propose to her. Rex tells Natalie that Clint is an ass that needs to mind his own business. Rex hesitates to tell Bo what is bothering him because Clint threatened to send him to a Moroccan prison with David. He lies to Bo that David is partying in Ibiza and is in no hurry to return to Llanview. Nora goes to Bo's office, talks up Clint to Inez, and then tells Bo that they should have a dinner party for Clint and Inez. Bo doubts that Clint is serious about Inez. Bo tells Nora about Rex's suspicious behavior. Cristian calls Gigi to the Studio to wait for a model. Gigi is surprised when the male model arrives and undresses. When Cristian notices that she didn't draw the model's genital area, he tells her that she should find inspiration in the human body instead of being afraid of it. Rex is shocked to see the naked man when he walks into the studio.
Transcript: Destiny: What are you doing out here?
Dani: Hey. The judge asked me to wait outside.
Destiny: Why?
Dani: I don't know. It was getting kind of crazy in there. My dad was just about to make a statement.
Destiny: By "dad," you mean--
Dani: Ross. And then Todd came running in with your brother Greg.
Destiny: Greg is here?
Dani: Yeah, and that's when the judge asked me to leave, but, hey, why should I stay? It's only my life they're deciding. Oh, gosh, I wish I knew what was going on.
Destiny: Look. The way I see it, you have nothing to worry about. My brother is in there straightening everything out.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Judge Burdett: Dr. Evans, do you know Mrs. Manning's last wishes?
Greg: Yes, Your Honor. Téa made it perfectly clear to me that she wanted Ross Rayburn to raise Dani.
Todd: No. Wait a minute. That's a lie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: Hey, Inez, I'm heading for Rodi's. Do you want any--wow. Going somewhere special tonight?

Bo: Absolutely, and whoever you're going out with tonight, that's one lucky guy.

Clint: Yeah. So I'll get right to the point. Why have you been avoiding your old man?

Gigi: I'm on my way. Oop. I have to go. I'm afraid my new boss needs me.

Gigi: This is so amazing, Rex. I feel like, for the first time in my life, I am on a winning streak. First, I get into college, and then I get the grant. Of course, yes, I lost the grant, but then the money for Cristian to hire me as assistant just drops out of the sky. How lucky is that?
Rex: I wouldn't exactly call it luck.

Todd: Okay. Would you ask him why he's changed his story?
Judge Burdett: Mr. Manning, Dr. Evans is your witness, correct?

Judge Burdett: Then let's hear what he has to say. Dr. Evans, can you recount for us exactly what the late Mrs. Manning's wishes were regarding her daughter?

Greg: No. No. There's no mistake.

[SCENE_BREAK]
Greg: The night she died, Téa told me in no uncertain terms that she wanted Ross Rayburn to raise Danielle. She said she even put it into her will.
Judge Burdett: If this is true, why didn't you tell Mr. Manning or anyone else before now?
Greg: Well, I tried. I even went to Mr. Manning to break the news to him.
Todd: What? No. You told me that Téa wanted to see me before she died. You even tried to tell me that you felt guilty about having not told us when we were there.

Greg: That was a lie. After seeing how much Todd loved his daughter and the pain that he was going through because of the loss of his wife, I couldn't tell him the truth. So instead, I told him what I felt he needed to hear.

Morgan: Your Honor, if I may... Dr. Evans, if you knew Mrs. Manning stipulated this in her will, why lie about it? You must have known that once the will was in probate, Mr. Rayburn would come for his daughter.

Greg: Well, to the best of my knowledge, Mr. Rayburn was still a wanted man. I had no idea he was actually gonna show up with the will in his hand, but now that he has, I have no choice but to tell the truth.

Natalie: Yeah. So how did it go when you cornered Rayburn? Did you get anything out of him?
John: I was making some progress, and then he got summoned to Danielle's custody hearing.
Natalie: So I guess he didn't tell you if Eli Clarke is alive.
John: He was gonna tell the whole courtroom, but then he got interrupted.
Natalie: By Todd?
John: Manning gave him the best present he could ask for-- Dr. Greg Evans.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Greg: Look, Des. I really need to go, okay? Todd took me away from a very important patient, and I need to go back and check on them.
Destiny: Not until we have a little talk.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Ross: Honey, I don't blame Todd. If I were in his shoes, I wouldn't believe me, either, but fortunately, Dr. Evans was able to clear everything up. I mean, if anyone knew what your mother wanted before she passed on, it's him.
Danielle: I guess.
Ross: How about the way he went off on Dr. Evans? It had to scare you. It did me. The thought of you living with a guy like that-- I mean, he's out of control, honey. He doesn't deserve you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: You got to stop acting like a wild man. You're playing right into Ross' hands.

Blair: Yeah. I know what Téa wanted. She told me.
Todd: Okay. So you're with me on this one.
Blair: I am with you, all right?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cristian: Thanks, Joel. You can step down.
Joel: Should I get dressed?
Gigi: Yes. I know it's terrible.
Cristian: Actually, it's pretty good, but I have to ask. Why didn't you draw his--
Gigi: Yeah. I must've run out of time.
Cristian: You know, Gigi, the human body is the most natural thing in the world.
Gigi: Standing naked in the middle of the classroom.
Cristian: Right. You know, I think after a while, you'll get used to looking at a nude model as a form of inspiration and an object for study.
Gigi: Whatever you say, boss.
Rex: What the hell?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Clint: I took the liberty of ordering a special dinner for us at the country club because I thought you might enjoy trying some rare wines. How does that sound?
Inez: Sounds very generous, very sweet...
Clint: But?
Inez: I'm not sure what this all means.
Clint: Well, I want things to be just right.
Inez: For what?
Clint: There's something important I want to discuss with you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: A dinner party at our place with Clint and Inez.
Nora: What's wrong with that?
Bo: Doesn't that sound just a little bit uncomfortable to you?
Nora: No. It sounds like Clint and Inez is getting a little serious, and we should support them.
Bo: They've barely even been out on a date.
Nora: I know, but Inez told me that Clint helped get her son a grant for his education, so obviously, he cares.
Bo: No. No. Obviously, he's pushing just a little too hard to date her, which means that he's doing all of that because he has ulterior motives.
Nora: Oh, Bo, he's your brother. How can you be so suspicious?
Bo: It just comes with the job. That's all. Hey, you know what, hon? Speaking of suspicious, I ran into Balsom when I was at Rodi's.
Nora: Mm-hmm?
Bo: Something is going on with him.
Nora: Hmm? Like what?

Bo: I don't know. It-- here's the strange thing. It seemed like he wanted to tell me about something, but every time he got to the point where he was ready to tell me, then all of a sudden, he would just back off.
Nora: That doesn't sound like Rex at all, but--I don't know-- I wouldn't worry about it if I were you.
Bo: What, are you kidding me? This is Balsom we're talking about.
Nora: I know, sweetie, and you've just been a great father figure to him, but when he's ready to tell you, I bet he'll tell you.
Bo: Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cristian: Thanks again, Joel.
Joel: Yeah. Hey, man.
Rex: Hey. Okay. Who the hell was that?
Cristian: That was the life studies model.
Rex: Oh. Really? You never mentioned you'd be hanging out with a naked guy.
Gigi: Jeez, Balsom, what's gotten into you?
Rex: I'm sorry. It's just, it's kind of been a bad day.
Gigi: I see. So it's okay for you and Kelly to--
Cristian: To what?
Rex: Nothing. That was accidental and fast.
Gigi: Okay. Try not to look at him as a naked guy.
Rex: What should I look at him as?
Gigi: A form of inspiration and an object for study.
Rex: You know what? If you're happy, I'm happy.
Gigi: Ha!

John: Evans told the court that Téa wanted Danielle back with Rayburn.

John: That's a good question.

Greg: Look. I told you, Destiny, I have a patient waiting.
Destiny: And I told you, I need an answer. Were you telling the truth in there?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dani: Look. I know Todd lost it, but he's just scared of losing me, just like you were in Seattle.
Ross: Yeah, but the difference is, I've learned my lesson. I've changed. He never will.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: Either Téa didn't know what she was saying or Greg was lying, and we both know what she wanted.
Todd: You have no doubts?
Blair: None.
Bailiff: All rise.
